name: Account, Team, Organization Management in EFS
title: Account, Team, Organization Management in EFS
body:
Overview

This article provides comprehensive guidance on account management in EFS (Enterprise Feedback Suite). It covers the creation of organizations, teams, and user accounts, as well as special account types such as test accounts and reporting accounts. The guide also includes information on combined exports of participant details and survey results, and provides email templates for sending login information.

 

Information

Account management in EFS involves creating and managing organizations, teams, and user accounts. This guide outlines the steps for each process and provides important information for support staff and administrators.

  • General Information
  • Create an Organization
  • Create a Team
  • Create User Accounts
  • Test Account Provisioning
  • Account for an Accumulative Installation
  • Provisioning Reporting Accounts
  • Email Templates for Sending Login Information
  • Combined Export of Participant Details and Survey Results

General Information

Support only sets up accounts on shared installations and completely new installations.

On customer installations, the customer should always set up the accounts (members of the admin team), as Support cannot know whether the person is authorized to have access.

If an account needs to be created manually because the tac-script isn't available, follow these three main steps in the provided order:

  1. Create an organization
  2. Create a team
  3. Create user accounts

Wording and definitions:

  • An organization is the overall group which contains all teams and user accounts of a customer
  • A team contains user accounts to provide ACL rights in EFS to dedicated users
  • A user account is the account for a single person working in EFS

Create an Organization

  1. Log in to the installation
  2. Click on System tab> Users > click on navigation menu Organisations > click button Create organization
    1. Provide organization name
    2. Provide description
    3. Set date and time specifications for the runtime of the organization
    4. Set max amount of allowed users and projects for the organization
  3. Finish by clicking "Create"

Create a Team

  1. Log in to the installation

    1. Click on System tab> Users > click on navigation menu Teams > click button Create Team

    1. Provide team name

    2. Provide team title

    3. Provide description

    4. Set the owner of the team

    5. Define the access rights for the different areas in EFS 

    6. Pick a ACL rights template for the new team according to the target functionality of the new team and ensure the assignment

  2. Finish by clicking " Create team"

Create User Accounts

  1. Log in to the installation

    1. Click on System tab> Users > click on navigation menu Users> click button Create User Account

  2. Provide information in all required fields

    1. Fill all fields marked with (*)

    2. Choose a language

    3. Generate a password (clicking on the link "Generate Password" compiles a password automatically)

    4. Click on teams to mark them and assign the new user to the marked teams

      1. ONLY TIVIAN employees may be part of team System_Administrator NOBODY ELSE - including customers on dedicated installations

    5. Set a primary team for the new user

    6. Set an organization for the new user (in most cases the company name of the person receiving this user account)

    7. Time limit is provided by time span of users organisation

  3. Finish by clicking button "Create user account"

  4. Send login information to customer (unless otherwise specified in the order) - Securely Sending Passwords or Tokens

  5. Inform requester (e.g. Sales Account Owner)

Notes:

  • If projects need to be imported, make sure that the correct teams have access
  • If a high amount of accounts needs to be created, you can either use the text field of the tac-script, or use the user import function. For the latter you will have to create an organization and a team first

Test Account Provisioning

Requester fills out internal order survey, subject contains e.g. "Account for a test installation - [...]"

  1. New test accounts should always be ordered by whoever is requesting them via the survey: https://ww2.efs-survey.com/uc/order_survey/ 

  2. Log in to Globis, search term "test" and choose the newest version of EFS-Survey. The correct installation for test-accounts usually has a generic domain and is labeled as "Testinstallation" (e.g. for EFS 10.4 -> http://trial-survey.customervoice360.com/www/). If a test account for a panel installation has been requested, please contact sales or IGSC, as only one customer can use the panel test installation at a time.

  3. Log in to the installation

  4. Replace main.php?from_login=1 with tac.php (should the tac-script not be available, create organization, team and user manually and upload the test-projects afterwards).

  5. Fill out available / required information; set validity according to survey

  6. Select matching rights template (e.g. test account team)

  7. Send login information to customer

Account for an Accumulative Installation

Requester fills out internal order survey, subject contains e.g. "Account for a accumulative installation - [...]"

List of collective Installations:

Country URL
DE http://www.efs-survey.com/www
AT http://ww2.umfragecenter.at/www/

  1. New test accounts should always be ordered by whoever is requesting them via the survey: https://ww2.efs-survey.com/uc/order_survey/ 

  2. Log in to the matching installation

  3. Replace main.php?from_login=1 with tac.php (should the tac-script not be available, create organization, team and user manually).

  4. Fill out available / required information; set validity according to survey

  5. Select matching rights template (e.g. standard accumulated installation team)

  6. Send login information to customer

Provisioning Reporting Accounts

  1. Reporting accounts will usually be ordered by the customer

  2. Log in to the customer's installation

  3. Navigate to Users to check whether the intended recipient already has an account

  4. If this is the case, navigate to projects, search for the project the report should be granted for, click the § icon and grant read-access to the team in question

  5. If this is not the case, navigate to teams, create a team using the reporting-rights template, navigate to projects, search for the project the report should be granted for, click the § icon and grant read-access to the team

    1. Navigate to Users and create an account in the team that you just created. Set organization to the customer's organization.

  6. Send login information to the person you just created the account for

  7. Inform requester, that reporting access has been granted

Email Templates for Sending Login Information for Accounts

Template German Template English

Subject: Ihre Zugangsdaten für EFS Survey von TIVIAN

Sehr geehrte/r Frau/Herr ...

vielen Dank für Ihr Interesse an den Produkten der TIVIAN.
Anbei finden Sie Ihre Zugangsdaten zu EFS Survey.

Installations-URL:
Accountname:
hinterlegte E-Mail-Adresse:

Aus Sicherheitsgründen wird Ihnen der Link zum Neusetzen des Passworts
in einer separaten E-Mail zugeschickt.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass Sie beim ersten Login aufgefordert werden Ihr
Passwort zu setzen und Ihre Sicherheitsfrage festzulegen. Sollte dies nicht der Fall sein, kontaktieren Sie bitte den Tivian-Support, indem Sie dieser Anleitung folgen: Getting the most out of Discover XI ATLAS Support Chat.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Subject: Your login data for EFS Survey by TIVIAN

Dear ...

thank you for your interest in the products offered by TIVIAN.

Please find hereafter your access data for EFS Survey

Installation-URL:
Accountname:
Registered e-mail address:

For security reasons your password will be sent in a separate mail.

Please note that upon first logging in you will be asked to change
your password and select a security question.
Should this not be the case, please contact Tivian Support by following this guide: Getting the most out of Discover XI ATLAS Support Chat.

With kind regards

 

 

Combined Export of Participant Details and Survey Results 

  • Create a team: name this team <same team name as the already had>_dp
    Assign ACL rights template "decontrol_privacy", (which normally is a standard team on all instances
  • Add user to the team

Users would be able to see the combined export option after that.
